summary:
Belladonna is a poisonous plant found in Europe and Western Asia, also known as deadly nightshade. It's related to common food plants like tomatoes and potatoes. All parts of this plant, especially the berries, are very toxic if eaten. They contain chemicals called tropane alkaloids, which can cause hallucinations and serious health problems.

The plant has attractive lily-like flowers and ball-shaped berries, making it deceptively beautiful. It's crucial to avoid consuming it, as it can be deadly. If exposed, specific antidotes can help.
title: Atropa belladonna
